p:
The incubation period is estimated to be 8 to 9 days.
9 The most common symptoms reported by patients are rash and arthralgia, both of which occur in more than 90% of cases. The rash typically appears on the trunk and limbs first, as macules and progressing to papules, with all lesions usually in the same stage of development.
2 Distribution may include all four extremities, including palms and soles; the face is usually spared. The rash may persist for more than 5 days.
